word_mean: 丁香，丁子香，鸡舌香：一种芳香香料，为丁香树(Eugenia caryophyllus)的干燥花芽
以前用作驱风药，减轻恶心呕吐，也用于促进消化。另见oil项下的clove oil

sentence.Network_en: Leave each garlic clove in its papery skin.
sentence.Network_cn: 每瓣蒜外面的薄皮都要留着。

sentence.Network_en: He still clove to this ideal.
sentence.Network_cn: 他仍然坚守着这个理想。

sentence.Network_en: Heat a couple of tablespoons of olive oil, a chopped clove of garlic and some black pepper in a heavy saucepan.
sentence.Network_cn: 将几勺橄榄油、一片切碎的蒜瓣和一些黑胡椒粉放入深平底锅里加热。

...7、卷结：又称墨水结。在两方向负荷相同时使用。组合木材固定的时候用。, 8、双套结(clove hitch)：又称丁香结。可用于固定，也用于攀登和下降。, 9、绳头结：又称艾曼斯结。结组第一人与最后一人用于绳索与安全带连接处。也可用于保护绳的支点上。.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French clou de girofle, literally 'nail of gillyflower' (from its shape), gillyflower being originally the name of the spice and later applied to the similarly scented pink
Old English clufu, of Germanic origin, corresponding to the first element of German Knoblauch (altered from Old High German klovolouh), and the base of cleave

entry.def: Cloves are small dried flower buds which are used as a spice.
A clove of garlic is one of the sections of a garlic bulb.
Clove is a past tense of cleave.

means.word_mean: 1. aromatic flower bud of a clove tree; yields a spice
2. moderate sized very symmetrical red-flowered evergreen widely cultivated in the tropics for its flower buds which are source of cloves
3. one of the small bulblets that can be split off of the axis of a larger garlic bulb
4. spice from dried unopened flower bud of the clove tree; used whole or ground
